channel.title: ::pure help (PI) (317)

item.title: ::pure help (PI) (317)
item.dc:creator: @rhys132 rhys132
item.description:
@rhys132 wrote:

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pure”) && c.pure == 0) {
for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
for (int o = 2; i < 5; i++) {
c.playerLevel[0] = 99;
c.playerLevel[1] = 1;
c.playerLevel[2] = 99;
c.playerLevel[3] = 99;
c.playerLevel[4] = 99;
c.playerLevel[6] = 99;
c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.playerXP[1] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(1);
c.playerXP[o] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
c.pure = 1;
}
}
}

[/code]
Enjoy!

Read full topic

item.title: ::pure help (PI) (317)
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { if (c.inWild()) return; c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(60)+5; c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(0); c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(70)+5; c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(2); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(70)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(70)+5; c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(4); c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(55)+5; c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(6); }

This should work. You’ll have to change some things to what your needs require.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pure help (PI) (317)
item.dc:creator: @RuneForge_RSPS RuneForge RSPS
item.description:
@RuneForge_RSPS wrote:

Hey, I’ve been working on my pk server for a few days now, and I am making ::pure, and ::master for all the players who join. But, once players do ::master, they will get 99 in all combat stats, which is what I want. But when I do ::pure after that, it works, i know, but it doesn’t change the defence level back to one. Here is my pure command.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure") && c.pure == 0) { int i = 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 1); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 5); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.pure = 1; }

Now, I thought I had a good brain moment when I thought if I added this line, it would reset the defense skill.

Sadly, that code didn’t do anything, but I didn’t receive any errors either.
Now, this is okay, if no one can get this to work, I’d just have to get a ::resetdef command.

Read full topic
